history.content: You don't have to create the universe...  ;)  It just defines the range of possible values you would ever possibly pull from to be a member of the set.  The lecture videos have a good example using passwords as the topic.  If you made up rules that a password could be at most 8 characters long then the universe of possible passwords could be any permutation of 8 characters from the allowed character sets.

You don't have to create the universe...  ;)  It just defines the range of possible values you would ever possibly pull from to be a member of the set.  If you have watched the lecture videos it has a good example using passwords as the topic.  If you made up rules that a password could be at most 8 characters long then the universe of possible passwords could be any permutation of 8 characters from the allowed character sets.

you can use the data given with the project - the pre-draw numbers in the input text file - for all tasks.  task 1 will also require you to use some kind of correlated data, but you can create that yourself.

I've searched the forums and haven't found anything on this so hopefully, I haven't missed a relevant post. This is for Task1

I tried to initialize U by creating an array from (0, N-1) without repeats where N=2147483647. This took a long time in python. I'm guessing this isn't how it should be done. Do we have to maintain an array for U at all or just draw random number from range (0, N-1)? If we are supposed to draw randomly then couldn't a number be drawn twice and end up hashed to two different locations in n? 

Thanks
history.subject: Initializing N
